website_summaries.verdict: A quality gun that serves as an excellent base for modifications.
pros: Loading pellets into this gun is simple, they fall right into place
The gun is powerful, with just 4 quick pumps you can shoot through a stack of paper magazines
This model is easy to upgrade and modify for a small cost
Shots remain accurate and straight for up to 10 yards
cons: Quick follow up shots not possible

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever pellet gun (I'm 60) and I am surprised at how powerful it is. With 4 pumps the pellet penetrates 3 layers of cardboard and 40 pages of a magazine. Loading is easy and the pellet seems to always easily fall into place. The pistol grip and the pump grip are plastic that seems adequate for the stresses put on them. This is a good product that should be used with care, caution and common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: 1377 to a match pistol
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money. Loads of fun, and great opportunity to modify to suite needs. I have added Match grip and sight, with a brass barrel band and a steel breech... it's now a half decent target match pistol. Needed to lighten the trigger pull from 5lb to 1.5lb, by careful compression of trigger spring.
customer_reviews.author: B. G. Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for the money
customer_reviews.text: If I had paid $100, I would gripe about a few things like the trigger pull and the plastic breech, but it's pretty easy to remedy most of the gun's defects if you really want to. Some people end up dumping hundreds of dollars into this gun because it's such a great platform for customizing, but I've already solved the trigger pull issue for free by filing off a few rough spots and polishing with a Dremel tool. I'll probably add a steel breech and a red dot sight for about $75 total, and then it will be as perfect as I want it to be. At least for now....
customer_reviews.author: jmac2112

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC.  Front sight visibly canted left.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the first gen versions as a kid. Beat it to death and it kept on working. It shot BBs and pellets and it was deadly. I got one of these new models and the first thing I noticed when opening it was that the front sight was canted to the left. There's no way to adjust that, a little reading revealed this is pretty common and the gun has to be returned to Crosman to be fixed. I opted to send it back to Amazon for a refund instead of gambling on another misaligned site.
customer_reviews.author: cspu

customer_reviews.title: Crossman P1377
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful. I use it for pigeon control and it works great. I was trying to use a Co2 pistol but every time I went to use it the cartridge would be empty. This is a no fuss, pump up as much air power as you want. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H

customer_reviews.title: Not enough power to get the pellet out of the barrel
customer_reviews.text: This crossman pellet gun didn’t have enough power to get the pellet out of the barrel after 10 pumps.... Its a piece of junk... I had the same type of crossman pellet gun years ago and it was a shooter....
customer_reviews.author: zoomer

customer_reviews.title: Good and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price. So I cant complain. I bought this as a survival option for the upcoming population purge aka: coronavirus! 😆 Robins, squirrels and rabbits will be fair game, although I wont advicate illegal hunting. I wanted that option to feed myself. The plastic grips and pump arm is really cheap thin plastic but you get what you pay for. I bought my pellets at walmart for $3.00 +/- /250 count pointed pellets. I bought up the WHOLE display!!! NO JOKE! I got 10 boxes! I had one of these as a teenager in high school. So I knew I wanted another one. This gun will be alot of fun popping small game, if need be.
customer_reviews.author: BADD DAWG

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $
customer_reviews.text: Finally gave up on this pistol. I'm a dead shot with anything close to accurate. Have had to sight this in 3 times and it's way off again. Obvious poorly manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Billadelphia

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels on the run
customer_reviews.text: I really need a rifle as those squirrels are small and know how to scamper. I only shot one and he took off and I don't know if it died. I use traps to catch the squirrels now. I don't eat them. (Oh, and I do like animals but the squirrels dig into my garden and plants. Don't fret, there are too many squirrels for me to get all of them.)
customer_reviews.author: fischman26

customer_reviews.title: as powerful as you like, great for casual use out of the package, or as a base to upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Liked the accuracy potential (and realized, too, after fiddling) but the sights are what you get at this price point. You can adjust them easily enough, and hope they stay put. Most people who get serious upgrade theirs and it's easy to do but expect that your out of pocket will double when you do. Kind of hard for some people to pump, so see if you can try one first before buying. This is a classic US made product, been in production over 40 years, and VERY good quality and performance for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J

customer_reviews.title: Cool little pellet guy.  I am reliving my childhood...
customer_reviews.text: Pellet gun arrived quickly and in perfect condition. It was fairly accurate out of the box. I did add some orange and white dots to the sights which my aging eyes struggled to see properly. I have fired it about 100 times so far and everything continues to work well. The pumping mechanism may actually be working better.
customer_reviews.author: Frank E. Hurtte

customer_reviews.title: They downgraded this model from 25 years ago. It used to be able to shoot BB's but no longer.
customer_reviews.text: This item had a great version 25 years ago, but now they decided to make it without the crucial magnetic tip to the bolt action. So as a result you can't use BBs in this, ONLY PELLETS. BB's will just slide out the end of the barrel unless you angle the gun upwards. This is just awful. They only saved a couple dimes on making that part not a magnet and ruined a good design. Now i don't want to buy anything from this company that i once owned long ago, because i fear it will just not be as functional as i need or had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Lynton Wallabe

customer_reviews.title: crossman p1377
customer_reviews.text: this is a fun little gun with lots of power for a pistol. I wanted something that could should pellets and did not use co2 cartridges. this fit the bill. Only reason for 4 stars is it is not as accurate as i thought. shoots well, but not quite as tight as I hoped. I will experiment with more types of pellets and update if it gets better. but for what it is and the price, i would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great gun for the price. Added steel breach and custom stock.
customer_reviews.text: This gun is pretty accurate right out of the box. I replace the stock plastic breach with the Crosman steel breach. The breach creates a solid connection with the barrel and keeps the barrel from moving. I recommend it for this gun. It also gives you a place to mount an optic. Oh, and get the custom stock. It helps greatly with accuracy. Only 4 stars because of the plastic breach. I paid $43 for the .177 model.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Tup

customer_reviews.title: Big hands/Lefty? This is for you.
customer_reviews.text: I had this air pistol (well, the wooden handled version) as a kid and just received this model this morning. After firing roughly 100 pellets (Crossman Destroyer) here's my takeaway: For the price you cannot do better. Accurate (put every pellet into a tennis ball sized group at roughly 50'), has zero kick - I mean none, fairly quiet (not much louder than my Gamo Whisper rifle), and most importantly - it fits my big left hand. It almost seems designed for south paws; can pop open the pump, check the chamber, set/release the safety all with my thumb and/or forefinger without releasing my grip on the weapon. Been using Crossman air-guns since '76...there's a reason.
customer_reviews.author: G.H.

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I don't have this any longer, but it was invaluable to help me control the squirrel population which had been creating serious damage to my solar panels, deck chairs and other parts of the property. As long as I shot straight, it hit what I wanted to hit and remained useful. I'm grateful my former law enforcement authorities approved its use in my situation.
customer_reviews.author: John Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Rat Killer
customer_reviews.text: pump it up to the full value (10 pumps) , take careful aim, kill a rat in 1 shot. Actually , that is a must, it is a single shot and the rat is long gone, if you miss or don't pump it for max FPS. I take my Dog out under the Avocado tree nightly for a hunting session and anything I knock out of the tree, she can finish off. Good value and fun to kill the enemy. I hate rats!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Air Pistol
customer_reviews.text: The pump is smooth, even at higher pressures. The sights are accurate, and it has never failed to fire. I like that the bolt acts as the cocking mechanism so you can just load, pump, and shoot. I didn't want or need a semi-auto or something that could hold more than 1 pellet at a time, so this pistol is perfect. 30+ years later and Crosman continues to impress me with their products.
customer_reviews.author: SpicyLlama

customer_reviews.title: Very Accurate Air Pistol
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most accurate air pistol I own. Great fun to shoot. Kind of a pain to pump though. I have added a stock to mine and turned it into a carbine. Makes it even more fun to shoot in my opinion. The stock also makes cocking the gun a bit easier.
customer_reviews.author: CapCase

customer_reviews.title: Buy a blank gun if you want noise - you can't hit the side of a barn with a pellet with this one!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very impressive in the description. It feels awesome in hand. It is heavy and impressive. Problem is you can't hit the broadside of a barn from 30 feet away. I have3 other air pistols and bought this one because of the 690 FPS which is fast. It doesn't matter how fast the pellet goes out. if you can't get close to a target... what good is it. Buy a blank gun if you want to hear a pop. Sadly not recommened at all!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Morris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, much improved with the steel breech!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1377 40yrs ago but got lost in the shuffle of moves. Recently bought this one. At the recommendation of many also bought the steel breech upgrade and a BSR red dot. I tried the open sights at first. Not bad accuracy free hand. I replaced the breech, a very easy upgrade, installed the scope and sighted it in at 75ft. Easily got 2" groups. It's an excellent air pistol and highly recommend these upgrades. Look out roof rats, your days are numbered!
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: This ole classic is a classic for a reason. Crosman is a trusted name and this is very powerful. A co2 pistol is nowhere near this gun. Mine penetrated around 2 inches of cardboard with pointed pellets, my co2 got thru about 1 inch with the same ammo. Also because it's got the velocity, the pellets stay on target and do NOT drop. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: George Taniguchi

customer_reviews.title: First time pellet gun owner, the accuracy just blown my mind!
customer_reviews.text: I've sight in this Crosman P1377 roughly, can't wait to do some shooting test. I placed 3 quarters at 30 feet, then start to shoot, it took me 2 rounds to take down the first coin with 4 pumps, 3 rounds to put down the second coin with 4 pumps. Then I begin to pump it 10 times and it took down the last coin by the first round. Wow! That's just the factory sight and my scope is on the way, I'm so glad for this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ren

customer_reviews.title: Good for getting rid of pests
customer_reviews.text: I owned the p1377br as a kid and remember how accurate it was, so I decided to try this one out. Paid the same amount I did 25 years ago. I had a huge problem with rabbits eating everything and destroying plants and flowers. The dog fails horribly at getting rid of them. Basically the weapon is ready to go out of the box. Didn't play with the sights just pumped 8 times and one round to the head with a destroyer pellet good night. My wife was pleased no more rabbits in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: slappy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The classic pump up pellet pistol. New design of pump arm protects fingers. Easy to upgrade with steel breech kit and better rear sight for $75, turns this gun into a match grade target pistol. Will shoot almost any shape pellet, seems to prefer RWS Domed
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Schnurr

customer_reviews.title: Too much effort
customer_reviews.text: Too much effort to load a pellet. You should be able to pull the bolt back, drop a pellet in and slide the bolt forward to load the pellet. Didn't work on this gun. I didn't check it with a magnet, but the bolt appeared to be plastic. Cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Great gun for great price .
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Crossman P1377 and it shoot sweet .I have one of the old ones I have had for years and it cocks differently (pull back the end )and the pellet housing is different but both shoot the same with the same power . Shot in my back yard into an old plastic trash can and with 10 pumps it went through (8 pumps did not ) shoots on the x too . Yes I would recommend to anyone that wants a nice pellet gun.( shot daisy precision max hollow point pellets 7.8 grains )
customer_reviews.author: Donald Rutter

customer_reviews.title: Rat eliminator (big rats)
customer_reviews.text: Extremely accurate. Gets a little quieter the more shoot. I bought it because several rats mistook my shed for their new home. 10 pumps takes out the foot long rats that could feed a family of four from a good 15-20 feet. At first I was so irritated with them, now it's my nightly adventure that drives the wife insane. Thanks Crossman! (my wife hates you)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and powerful pellet pistol
customer_reviews.text: Recommended. Keep in mind that this is basically a small caliber firearm. With 10 pumps and decent pellets it will penetratet 1/4" plywood easily, same with think metal soup cans. It's a great first gun for kids (provided theyre supervised or responsible enough to own it) and useful for pest control or backyard plinking, but is capable of doing some damage if mishandled.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Williams

customer_reviews.title: Crosman pump air pistol
customer_reviews.text: Was hard to pump , but for any man great , little harder for a child or woman , when you get to 3rd pump , overall wonderful pistol ,
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne grant

customer_reviews.title: The nice thing about the upgrade route
customer_reviews.text: When fist looking at air pistols, I was surprised to learn that 5 & 10 meter match pistols cost as much or more than many semi-auto firearms. For less than $70, you get a basic pistol capable of dropping pellets in the same hole at those ranges. You will be surprised to find that just about every bit and piece on this model can be upgraded or modified until you have a near Match Grade pistol. The nice thing about the upgrade route, is that you don't have to spend all your money at once.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Dilettante

customer_reviews.title: New hobby pistol.
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly accurate. 1 inch groups at 35 feet in a supported position using the PEEP sight. Place the sight as low as it will go and aim at the 6 o'clock portion of the target. I was shooting at, and hitting 3/4 dot marked on a paper plate. Cheap pellets were used.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Haskell

customer_reviews.title: Nice pistol
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels are tearing up bar pool screen cage. Therefore I got this pellet gun. This thing is powerful enough to keep them away if not eliminate them altogether. $50 on a pellet gun or $2,400 on a new pool cage. Money well spent. Only downside the site is not adjustable and it seems to be a little crooked.
customer_reviews.author: Pete S.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made pistol. The wight and feel is very good. 6-7 pumps will penetrate 1/4 cardboard and deep-dent an aluminum sign 1/8" thick. I only wish it was not a single shot. 10 shot mag would have been perfect. I'd recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Maramara

customer_reviews.title: Love the gun, but it's cheaper made than the old one i own.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1980's version of this model which is better than this model. The newer model, this one, is cheaper made, but i must admit it works just as well so far. For people who say it's hard to pump, i say the old one was the same until you break it in. I am a fan of the older style, but the newer one has a few better things. You really should buy the stock for it, makes it allot more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Swazzie

customer_reviews.title: Good accuracy
customer_reviews.text: It was dark when I got home. I opened the package, took out the 1377, pumped it twice and dropped in a pellet. My first shot hit a 3" soup can lid target at 22 yards. I could barely see the target. Didn't even have to sight it in.
customer_reviews.author: Gary DeRoy

customer_reviews.title: Good for pest control
customer_reviews.text: Effective at short range (10-15 yds). Operation of the single-shot pellet pistol is straightforward. Rear sight offers peep and notch (my preference) options. Painted front sight (ramp) red to improve contrast. Last (10th) pump requires more effort but nothing excessive. Keep an eye on the pump handle pivot pin—tends to drift out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works well for what I use it for. Use daily / nightly
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice fair quality, price should could have been a little better. Not going to give an intensive review. Nice not to rely on CO2,nice to have variable power. Not to loud, I live in South Warren MI. It's a ghetto being over run with rats & have shot quite a few of them with this.
customer_reviews.author: john sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great gun!
customer_reviews.text: Gave it just 3 stars for accuracy because out of the box it needs adjusting, which I know is expected but we all know someone will buy it and blow up over it not shooting straight lol. But seriously this is a 5 star pellet gun. Shoots well and is cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Carr

customer_reviews.title: Could be better quality
customer_reviews.text: The old adage applies here, they don't make them like they used to. Quality of this back in the day was spot on, not parts are replaced by plastic, not impressed. Still shoots just not impressed with the quality of parts.
customer_reviews.author: Obake

customer_reviews.title: Good for target practice, not for shooting small game or pests.
customer_reviews.text: Fun target pistol, but NOT for eliminating small pests such as the gophers that are destroying our garden. Pumped it up ten times and only wounded a gopher at 20 yds with a direct hit. Very inhumane. I'll just use it for target practice from now on.
customer_reviews.author: White Wolf

customer_reviews.title: true classic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air pistol to replace an older one that I gave to my Dad. I wasn't sure if the quality would be the same but to my pleasant surprise its every bit as good. I should also say there have been some improvements, mainly the addition of a bolt action type breech lock. This is far better than the sliding shield on the old model. This inexpensive pistol is way better than it should be for the price, easy to use and accurate .
customer_reviews.author: steven schrader

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: A nice pellet gun for small critters and pests. I used it short range only 20-30 feet but it was dead on. I am sure it can be accurate farther but havent tested. Killed rats with one shot to the head at that range
customer_reviews.author: vaporman

customer_reviews.title: Great gun and value.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying this pistol in my indoor garage range. Great price and love the all black. To me.....Only negative is the sights. I lowered the rear all the way down and it still shoots high. I just have to adjust my sight picture and it is fine. Fiber optics would be a nice upgrade. Might try some white paint on the front site blade. I think it is good quality for the price. It is pretty accurate and fun to shoot. I have had a old 766 crosman 177 since the early 80's. It needs some tlc but has always been a great shooter for pellet/ BB gun. I think Crosman is quality and value in one!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Uley

customer_reviews.title: Total junk.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Fires nothing. Not a single pellet. I only ever use Crosman. 177 pellets in my air guns. It appeared to be previously opened. I owned one if these in the '80s. The quality has really dropped off.
customer_reviews.author: DARREN SCHLEEF

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for plinking. Works great. Easy to use, fairly accurate even at range. Great little gun, tons of fun for all experience levels. Be safe! Not a toy!
customer_reviews.author: Dr H

customer_reviews.title: Too much fun!
customer_reviews.text: Too much fun! Easy to operate, great plinker, I shoot indoors with backstop at 15-25', keeps my skills up for the real stuff. Only issue is that it shoots high and the elevation adjustment came from the factory as low as it will go, that is why I took one star away.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Very hard pumping
customer_reviews.text: This pistol has a problem. When you try to shoot more than 10 yards, you pump 6 or more times, but the hanger is very short for pushing so hard. I think Crosman must provide this pistol with a larger pumper adapter or a valve for put air with an external device. In this conditions unfortunately is very hard.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive target gun, and not expecting superior accuracy. I can shoot groups that will hit a silver dollar at 25 feet with this, so I'm very happy with it. Balance and trigger action could be better, but as it is, it's fine for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Wave addict

customer_reviews.title: do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: waste of money, you can see the pellet in flight.
customer_reviews.author: scott e alamprese

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate from 25 ft away with about an inch grouping with 3 pump. Still very good at 50 ft away with 4 pump. Still hitting my target. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker

customer_reviews.title: High power perfection
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to carry in you Backpack when your out and about on that week long hike and need to reach out and get that squirrel or rabbit for dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pack rats beware
customer_reviews.text: Had an older version of this product which was made during some "cheap years". Did not have the bolt action, had the metal shroud instead. Like this one much better.
customer_reviews.author: spongebob9253

customer_reviews.title: Great pellet gun for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived and functions good. Well assembled, and oiled. Great pellet gun for the money. Sights appeared cheap at first glance, but are easy to use. Shoots strong. I'm glad I ordered it. Great backpack gun for harvesting small critters, for the stew pot.
customer_reviews.author: Warne

customer_reviews.title: Good value for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Good value for what it is. If you're looking to drill tacks at 50 yards, this ain't the pistol. But if you want to knock pine cones out of a tree, or shoot your wife's commemorative plates in the living room. this pistol works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mortimer Snerd

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great, powerful and accurate pellet pistol offered at a terrific price.  Get one!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pellet pistol offered at a terrific price! It has plenty of power and is very accurate. I’ve already used it to take out a couple of pocket gophers, and I don’t mean on a date, other than a date with destiny. It seems to be very well-made, and I look forward to using it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gun
customer_reviews.text: The pistol arrived quickly. The sights were way off but I dialed them in and now they work well. I added a shoulder stock for stabilization and have a Red Dot sight on order. A low cost alternative to the Benjamin Marauder.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be decent for $75-ish. Trigger is a bit sticky, but it’s new out of the box. I had a brown one years ago, this seems to about the same.
customer_reviews.author: C. Prine

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good pump action pellet gun. One pump will bounce off a can two pumps will go through a can and move it and three pumps will go straight through can without moving it. It is very accurate an easy to operate. I also like that it is all black and has a black synthetic stock.
customer_reviews.author: who doesn't love this game!? use  this app for my kindle fire. works great. Love it!!!!!

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing pistol for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing pistol for the price. Very accurate and every bit of 600 fps. It's a great target gun or small game hunting gun. You can't go wrong with this pistol it's worth every dime
customer_reviews.author: Bushcrafter

customer_reviews.title: This gun is A lot of fun and VERY powerful for a hand gun
customer_reviews.text: This gun is A lot of fun and VERY powerful for a hand gun. Can shoot right threw 6 filled soda cans with just 12 pumps! My only problem with it is the sights are adjustable, but I still cannot get then perfect becuase the sight will not move any more down, and a little to the left! It's a bit frustrating, but can be fixed by buying a attachable sight! Great product other wise, definitely buy it! (Buy a scope as well, trust me)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crosman pellet pistol
customer_reviews.text: Great rat killer. Very accurate. Well made. Easy to use. Treat it as any firearm, because is a deadly weapon to some. I highly recommend it for either target shooting or small varmint radication.
customer_reviews.author: Homer H. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Love this classic Crossman pistol works like a charm fun ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this classic Crossman pistol works like a charm fun to shoot and very accurate already started to do some upgrades like still breach shoulder stock and some high definition paint for the front and rear sites
customer_reviews.author: Old working man

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit and finish with flawed assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, product build was not up to snuff. Just not the same as my 20 year old model in terms of materials, fit and finish. Something as basic as the site screw holes being tapped incorrectly and the barrel attachment. Not even good for goofing around. Definitely will shoot my eye out so went into the trash after a week of attempted fixes.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff K

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the gun I've purchased both the premier hollow point pellets and they don't fit.. not I've purchased BB's and they just roll out the barrel!! Not sure if its defective ive never successfully used it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NEVER GOT A SHOT1st  !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 1 ST One Pumped up fine but never even shot 1 Premiere Pellet Highly Disappointed :( Jammed using the 1st 3 tries !!!! JUNK !!! UPDATE : NOW!!! After receiving a replacement From Amazon THIS THING LIVES UP TO ALL EXPECTATIONS !!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: not so well made. cheap plastic parts.
customer_reviews.text: the price is ok, but the parts are cheap plastic. not accurate at all. good for use as a plinker on a 10 inch group at 15 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Think it was more of want than a need.
customer_reviews.text: On time. Well packaged. Oiled componitents but have not fired yet.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Second day of shooting targets I noticed there was a ...
customer_reviews.text: Second day of shooting targets I noticed there was a slight leak of air past the seals. I oiled the seals with pellgunoil and that didn't help returning.
customer_reviews.author: J. P

customer_reviews.title: accurate
customer_reviews.text: Added a scope and it is accurate. Used it to get rid of pests. 4 or 5 pumps is enough.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ar

customer_reviews.title: Many would find the pump hard to operate.
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok for the price range. Wife wanted it but she couldn't pump the lever to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky evans

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this air pistol to get rid of the birds nesting in a barn and leaving droppings on everything, does the trick quite well, have gotten rid of over 30 so far!
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty basic pellet pistol, I've put several thousand pellets through it and it has held up fine. I can hit an 12 inch circle at 25 yards every time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to have close by
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to use on a rodent than a air rifle. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Different from the original ones
customer_reviews.text: More cheaply made over the original ones. Good compression, no longer has a magnetic firing pin that used to hold bb from rolling out barrel.
customer_reviews.author: Village idiot

customer_reviews.title: Great product from Crosman
customer_reviews.text: Great product from Crosman. Good construction. Mostly metal. Some high impact plastic. Very accurate. Has adjustable rear site either notched or peep site. Has alot of power also. Typical Crosman pump. Pellets only single shot bolt action. Grip fits hand great. Cant beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stonebridge Smith

customer_reviews.title: More humaine that poison
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old one that I lost. Great for killing garden robbers and small tree destroyers.
customer_reviews.author: Alvina

customer_reviews.title: not as pretty as my very old one with walnut grips
customer_reviews.text: classic pump air pistol. not as pretty as my very old one with walnut grips, but, ok.
customer_reviews.author: migo

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you'll like it
customer_reviews.text: Great little pellet pistol. You don't get more accurate than this. I can consistently hit a quarter at 25 feet. Buy it, you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: Obie R. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable air pistol
customer_reviews.text: The pistol is very accurate and power can be controlled by the number of pumps, from 2 to 8. I'd recommend different sights, as the ones provided present a difficult sight picture. This product should last you for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Abram E. Katz

customer_reviews.title: Great pellet pistol for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great pellet pistol. The open sights are okay, added the scope and its great now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian and/or Odessa

customer_reviews.title: Nice pellet gun
customer_reviews.text: Nice pellet gun. It's accurate and I can adjust how powerful it is. For the price it can't be beat. I wanted something I could use to practice shooting with in the basement, and have the option of getting rid of pests if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: drain_bamage

customer_reviews.title: Best learning air pistol!
customer_reviews.text: Great classic air pistol to teach young men to shoot! My 10yo boy would prefer the .22 anytime, but this is the safer way to learn.
customer_reviews.author: SB Investor

customer_reviews.title: Ive always loved crossmen and i needed a air gun for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Ive always loved crossmen and i needed a air gun for my long walk/adventure to alaska. The gun its self is great. It does everything i need it to BUT the barrel is loose to the scope and mount thats sole purpose is for the gun is wiggleing. I think my gun is just a little defective. Hopefully yours wont be. Gmail is penguinwithatoaster@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Braydon Schramski

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Site was mounted tilted to left. Could not be user fixed
customer_reviews.author: jeff ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Love my 1377
customer_reviews.text: The 1377 is a great pistol. I bought this one to modify. But I own a few of them. No air gun collection is complete without one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. No mis-fires. Pump it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. No mis-fires. Pump it to the max 10 times and it will take out those pesky squirrels at 10-15'.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K

customer_reviews.title: what a great purchase. I was skeptical of several reviews stating ...
customer_reviews.text: The P1377, what a great purchase. I was skeptical of several reviews stating the pump was wobbly and flimsy compared to earlier versions. Not so. This is a very tight, very accurate pistol, and surprisingly easy to pump. I immediately added the carbine stock. Love it. This will sit proudly with my old 760 Pumpmaster and Sheridan.
customer_reviews.author: gcat8th

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly accurate
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly accurate. Lots of fun in the backyard. My wife, who up until this point had never shot a gun in her life, was putting them in the bull at 30 feet after the first couple of shots.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Need to get rid of yard rodents this with a mounted scope
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon

customer_reviews.title: Great pellet gun.
customer_reviews.text: Love the long barrel on a hand gun. Very accurate shooting.
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: awesome pellet pistol
customer_reviews.text: The P1377 is a great pump up pellet pistol.I love it.Great for shooting targets and small pest.Had a small problem with the rear sight the small screw striped out.But it was an easy fix with a new a different screw.Even better with a small laser scope
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great pellet gun. The pump
customer_reviews.text: Very good pellet gun. This is my second one. Good velocity, accuracy, east to use. Has a good safety.
customer_reviews.author: David Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fun at a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is pew, pew, pew! Accurate and economically priced!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Funa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. I like the fact you can pump it up to the power level you need. Sights are so - so, but adding a scope helps big time. It is long for a pistol, but not too big. Gives you more to hold on to. Over all i'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Kills rats, squirrels and moles
customer_reviews.text: Excellent air pistol for squirrels to keep them off my bird feeders. And yes it will kill them with the right pellets, it may take a couple of shots to bring them down but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: PJC

customer_reviews.title: Good could be better..
customer_reviews.text: The iron sight front piece us made of plastic..should be metal as mine is came bent..this is bad because this gun has no way to mount a scope on it
customer_reviews.author: Dr.smooth

customer_reviews.title: Pests beware I am looking for you
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Change out the barrel for .22. I recommend this product and will buy again. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Purvas Talbert

customer_reviews.title: Nice air pistol. Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: This pistol works very well, sights were dead on right out of the box! Shoots hard!
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Nice pistol
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to control rabbits. It works great and seems to be pretty accurate. Well built.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Crosman American Classic Multi Pump Pneumatic Pellet Air Pistol, Black
product_meta.description: The .22-caliber pneumatic American Classic has a sleek, modern design and is the ultimate in backyard pellet target air pistols. Featuring a single shot bolt action for easier cocking and loading and a rifled steel barrel for accuracy. Get variable pump power with the easy-pump forearm and control the velocity up to 460 fps for your style of target shooting. Comes with a fully adjustable rear sight and fixed blade front sight. "Take It Outside" with Crosman.
feature_bullets: SYNTHETIC GRIP WITH RIFLED STEEL BARREL
PNEUMATIC DESIGN, VARIABLE PUMP POWER - Control velocity up to 600 fps
SINGLE SHOT BOLT ACTION - For easier cocking and loading
CROSSBOLT SAFETY - To ensure proper and safe handling
FIXED BLADE FRONT SIGHT AND ADJUSTABLE REAR SIGHT - To stay on target
